results.title: Music of the masters. No. 1. "On wings of song" - Mendelssohn
results.brief_description: A performance of Mendelssohn’s “On wings of song” by David Martin (violin), Barnard Richards (cello), Marie Goosens (harp). Arranged by H. Dexter. No dialogue.

results.title: Muscle beach
results.creator_credit: I Lerner, J Strick and Strick Film Company
results.brief_description: A humorous and poetic impression of the pursuit of physical culture on the San Monica Beach, California. The languor’s of a summer afternoon are contrasted satirically with the fervours of the body builders and devotees of physical exercise.

results.title: Murray River salination
results.brief_description: This film begins by showing the building of the Dartmouth Dam on the Mitta Mitta River to flush out the Murray River whose river basin is comparable to the Danube Basin, but has only 17% of the Danube’s flow. It shows the devastating impact of ever-increasing salinity in the Murray River on the agricultural productivity and the purity of Adelaide’s domestic water supply. Suggests ways of overcoming the salinity problem through saline interception schemes, such as those pioneered by the NSW government. A valuable insight to the political nature of the great Muray River by its custodians, Victoria, South Australia and New South Wales. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Murawina: where the children play
results.brief_description: Murawina is an Aboriginal preschool in Chippendale - an inner suburb of Sydney. In this film the Aboriginal women who run the preschool express their views on the desirability of running such programs for themselves.

results.title: Multicultural education: a teaching style
results.creator_credit: Wayne Threm, David Arnold, Dennis Hicks and Media Five Film
results.brief_description: Looks at the change from the traditional “melting pot” theory to an appreciation of cultural pluralism. Several classroom approaches are demonstrated which encourage ethnic groups to maintain their identity and pride and at the same time learn mutual respect. Suitable for teacher/tertiary level.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Wayne Threm, David Arnold, Dennis Hicks and Media Five Film

results.title: Muffin by helicopter
results.brief_description: An episode of the children’s television show “Muffin the Mule” starring Annette Mills on piano and the puppets Muffin the Mule, Oswald the Ostrich, Grace the Giraffe and Peregrine Esq the Penguin. Muffin the Mule returns for a trip to France with a surpprise for Annette - a little giraffe called Grace.

results.title: Moving story
results.brief_description: Provides a brief history of trades shipping in Australia and goes on to outline the function of the Australia to Europe Shipping Conference. The conference comprises eighteen major international shipping companies including the Australian National Line which cooperate to provide a coordinated shipping service for the carriage of Australian exports to Europe at agreed freight rates. Highlights how the merger of technological and management skills can offer efficient service at reasonable rates. Suitable for upper secondary and teacher/tertiary levels.
